image.altText: A man walks towards left of camera on an AFL oval with Port Power and Sydney Swans players behind him

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide forward Willie Rioli withdraws from Saturday night's Showdown against the Crows.

title.children: Port Adelaide's Willie Rioli withdraws from Saturday's Showdown

image.altText: Liberal candidate Tom Venning with a campaign car.

props.synopsis: ABC election analyst Antony Green says, depending on preferences, an electoral battle in the seat of Grey could be "bad news" for the Liberals â€” but candidate Tom Venning remains confident of retaining the seat for the party.

title.children: Liberals at risk of losing one of their last two SA seats

image.altText: A woman wearing a red singlet holds a basketball above her head and looks to pass. A defender stands in front with arm raised.

props.synopsis: Adelaide will continue in the Women's National Basketball League (WNBL) after the league's new owners today announced a partnership with the SA government to keep the team alive.

title.children: Adelaide's WNBL team saved by SA government but no guarantees on 'Lightning' name

image.altText: A clear blue sky over paddocks in Auburn, SA

props.synopsis: As South Australia and Victoria continue to face drought and unseasonable heat, there has been a notable absence of major rain systems. So, what's going on?

title.children: Rainfall maps offer ominous insight where Australia's climate is headed

image.altText: a mother and daughter, facing each other smiling, on a sunny day standing in front of a red car.

props.synopsis: When Trini Hale first participated in the Shitbox Rally in 2023, she had no way of knowing she would be diagnosed with kidney cancer and rallying for herself two years later.

title.children: Mother and daughter do Lunchbox Rally road trip after cancer diagnosis

image.altText: Two small dead octopuses washed up on muddy sand.

props.synopsis: A toxic algal bloom linked with marine deaths across South Australia has grown to an unprecedented scale and will only be stopped by a change in weather, Environment Minister Susan Close says.Â

title.children: SA's toxic algal bloom 'larger than we have ever seen before'

image.altText: A painting of an old wooden sailing ship

props.synopsis: In 1857, the Koning Willem de Tweede sank off SA's south-east coast, and researchers are now confident they have found it.

title.children: Shipwreck lost for nearly 170 years finally found off SA coast

image.altText: A man walks up a ramp towards a door with a sign reading Naracoorte Courthouse, with a woman behind him and media to the side

props.synopsis: Independent MP Nick McBride has appeared in court for the first time since being charged with assaulting his wife.

title.children: SA MP appears in court over assault charges

image.altText: a group photo of a family of four. their faces are blurred.

props.synopsis: Charges have been dropped against a father accused of falsely claiming his child was undergoing cancer treatment to raise money â€“ while the childâ€™s mother is now facing 72 offences.

title.children: Alleged cancer deception mum facing new charges as father cleared

image.altText: A man with a blonde beard wearing a blue stripy polo shirt and a baseball cap

props.synopsis: An Adelaide father who had already been jailed for sexual offences has his sentence extended by 10 years over the manslaughter of his 21-day-old baby son, whom he fatally shook. WARNING: This story contains details that readers may find distressing.

title.children: Father who fatally shook baby has 10 years added to jail time

image.altText: A sign reading Port Augusta Prison Smoke Free Environmen outside a car park and brown building

props.synopsis: A new section of Port Augusta Prison had barriers that were constructed wide enough that a prisoner could slip through. The design flaw was fixed before the unit opened.Â

title.children: New SA prison unit had gaps 'large enough for a prisoner to squeeze through'

image.altText: Traffic along Adelaide's North East Road.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the circumstances of a hit-and-run crash that claimed the life of a 20-year-old woman on Adelaide's North East Road on Tuesday night.

title.children: Young woman killed in hit-and-run in Adelaide's north-east

image.altText: A man and a woman, both smiling, embrace with a small dog in their arms.

props.synopsis: A sausage dog that captivated the world after disappearing on a South Australian island for a year-and-a-half has been reunited with her "euphoric" owners. Her owners made the trip from their New South Wales home to Kangaroo Island where they were emotionally reunited.

title.children: Missing sausage dog reunited with 'euphoric' owners after 540 days

image.altText: A red sign with the Peterborough and a mini steam train model on top

props.synopsis: The Peterborough community in South Australia is questioning why its district council cannot keep a chief executive after the newest resigned after just two months in the job.

title.children: Council loses third CEO in 18 months with 'stunning' resignation

image.altText: Black smoke coming out of a chimney at sunset

props.synopsis: Clues as to the next pope's identity differ depending on who you talk to around the Vatican, but there's one thing people can agree on here: it was never going to be decided on Wednesday.

title.children: Conclave to enter second day as black smoke rises after pope vote

image.altText: people stand side by side on a hill to pay respects at a funeral in pakistani-controlled kashmir

props.synopsis: India launched the strikes early on Wednesday, saying it was targeting "terrorist camps" that served as recruitment centres. Pakistan says that was an "act of war".Â

title.children: Pakistani PM authorises 'corresponding actions' to Indian strikes as death toll rises

image.altText: Nagi Maehashi, a Japanese Australian woman wearing a black dress, smiles brightly while holding a rectangle-shaped award.

props.synopsis: A week after RecipeTin Eats founder Nagi Maehashi accused baker Brooke Bellamy of plagiarism, Maehashi has beaten her fellow cookbook author in a major prize.

title.children: Nagi's second book sold almost 300k copies last year. Now it's won a prize

image.altText: Men and children walk or stand on a small beach of yellow sand with palm trees fronting turquoise waters.

props.synopsis: Port Vila is rebuilding after a magnitude-7.3 earthquake â€” and residents see an opportunity to increase the city's tourism appeal.

title.children: Tourists flock back to city remaking itself after a deadly earthquake

image.altText: A cardinal on a phone

props.synopsis: The Vatican is protecting against drones and hidden microphones for the papal conclave.

title.children: Vatican goes high-tech to keep centuries-old meeting secret

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with a small Bluey toy and colourful dollhouse.

props.synopsis: More than 1,100 children may be left without daycare as the fate of centres run by the Genius childcare empire remains in limbo.

title.children: Millions in debt mounting as Genius childcare provider searches for lifeline

image.altText: A sketch of Erin Patterson wearing a blue jumper and thin framed black glasses with her hair tied back.

props.synopsis: A doctor's triple-0 call has been played in Erin Patterson's murder trial, with the GP heard asking police to find the Leongatha mother and return her to hospital.

title.children: Doctor gave blunt warning to Erin Patterson over mushroom poisoning risk, court hears

image.altText: An F/A-18 Super Hornet lands on the deck of an aircraft carrier

props.synopsis: Both members of the crew ejected before the jet plunged into the water and were recovered by a rescue helicopter, the official said.

title.children: Another US fighter jet falls into sea from Truman aircraft carrier, officials say

image.altText: A man in a light blue beanie, hoodie and headphones staring into the distance

props.synopsis: The site of a regional social housing project promised seven years ago has become a squat for the homeless in Bendigo, Victoria.

title.children: Land for long-awaited housing project becomes homeless campground

image.altText: Debris of an aircraft lie at the backyard of a house in Kashmir

props.synopsis: Air strikes by India against Pakistan are a major escalation in India-Pakistan tensions that experts say could, if taken to the extreme, result in nuclear conflict.

title.children: Full-scale war looms 'if missiles start raining' between India, Pakistan

image.altText: A ship pulls Taipan wreckage from the ocean, authorities are in a smaller watercraft nearby

props.synopsis: Major General Stephen Jobson told an independent inquiry into the crash that the problems with the Taipan fleet were well-known among higher-ups.Â

title.children: Taipan helicopters were 'underperforming', inquiry into fatal crash hears

image.altText: Onjuli, left, stands behind Mikaella, right, in a park while both gaze softly at the camera, wearing black.

props.synopsis: Mikaella and Onjuli met 13 years ago: one was couch-surfing across Europe; the other was living in Bristol and had a sofa. Now they're married and write smutty books together.

title.children: This married couple wrote a smutty lesbian horror novel together

image.altText: Bandt sits with his hand on his chin.

props.synopsis: Greens leader Adam Bandt has little in common with defeated Liberal leader Peter Dutton, but the pair now share the misfortune of being party leaders who lost their own seats in an election that saw Labor romp home.

title.children: Greens leaderless as Adam Bandt projected to lose in Melbourne

image.altText: A man in a grey jacket and white collared shirt smiles in front of a crowd dressed in blue shirts that say "Tim Wilson".

props.synopsis: The former Liberal member says he's humbled to gain another term in government and criticised the departing independent for not conceding defeat.

title.children: Wilson takes parting shot at Daniel in a teary victory speech

image.altText: volunteers wearing free palestine and Labor t-shirts hand out how to vote cards

props.synopsis:
Despite Labor's landslide win, a closer inspection of results in some electorates reveals a nuanced story about Muslim voters, campaigners say.Â 

Â

title.children: 'Mind-blowing': How Muslim voters shaped the election outcome

image.altText: A woman on a phone smiles

props.synopsis:
Palestinian photojournalist Fatima Hassouna was "Gaza's eye". Her death marks another journalist killed during the Israel-Gaza war, which has now become the "worst ever conflict" for journalists.

Â

title.children: Photojournalist Fatima Hassouna wanted 'a death the world will hear'

image.altText: Angus Taylor Sussan Ley

props.synopsis: Liberal deputy Sussan Ley and Shadow Treasurer Angus Taylor firm as the two likely contenders for the party's leadership, as a split emerges among Coalition MPs over what to do with its nuclear proposal.

title.children: Liberal leadership race narrows to two likely contenders, Ley and Taylor

image.altText: A teen with shoulder-length hair smiles as she sits in a living room.

props.synopsis: Jessica Small was kidnapped and likely murdered almost 30 years ago. Police have a identified a "potential person of interest" and a $1 million reward is on offer, but they still don't know what happened to the 15-year-old.

title.children: New bid to solve 27-year-old mystery of NSW teen's disappearance

image.altText: Jack Doohan, in a cap and spray jacket, walking through the F1 paddock.

props.synopsis: Australian Formula 1 driver Jack Doohan will be replaced for the next five race weekends.

title.children: Doohan dropped for next five races as Alpine 'rotates' drivers

image.altText: Maroons coach Tahnee Norris looks on during a post match press conference

props.synopsis: Queensland coach Tahnee Norris has resisted making sweeping changes despite needing to win Game II to save the women's Origin series, with only one new face on the bench.

title.children: Maroons coach resists urge to make mass changes for must-win Game II

image.altText: woman sitting by the water alone

props.synopsis: Loneliness often comes about when women are undergoing shifts in identity through life transitions such as perimenopause and empty nesting, experts say. Â

title.children: Sandy seemingly has a perfect marriage, but she's never been lonelier
